image.altText: A young artist at work.

props.synopsis: Advocates are concerned a nationwide shortage of paediatric rheumatologists puts children with juvenile idiopathic arthritis at risk of developing lifelong complications.

title.children: Ten-month wait for juvenile arthritis diagnosis 'way too long', clinician warns

image.altText: An aerial shot of Bowhill Engineering's site with three large buildings and two sheds. Vacant farm land is next to it..

props.synopsis: An engineering business in the small South Australian town of Bowhill is awarded a multi-million-dollar contract as part of the River Torrens to Darlington road upgrade, which it hopes will benefit the region.

title.children: Family-run engineering firm in tiny town celebrates $32m contract win

image.altText: SBS newsreader Mary Kostakidis

props.synopsis: A legal row between a former SBS television newsreader and a prominent Israeli Australian over tweets during the Israel–Gaza war has been described by one camp as a case of free speech, and the other as a case of hate speech.

title.children: Former SBS newsreader's social media posts trigger lawsuit

image.altText: Berri Courthouse sign in blue and white text. A green plant is in the foreground. The sky is overcast in the background.

props.synopsis: The founders of the South Australian Humane Animal Rescue Association, SAHARA, are facing 41 counts of ill-treatment of an animal and three counts of failing to comply with animal welfare notices.

title.children: Charity for humanely rehoming animals faces 41 ill-treatment charges

image.altText: A woman sits with her hands folded on her lap looking into the camera and smiling

props.synopsis: A mother found not guilty of attempted murder by way of mental incompetence after stabbing her two sons multiple times on an Adelaide motorway, has been sentenced to a limited fixed term of 12 years in a mental health facility.

title.children: Adelaide mother sentenced to time in mental health facility after stabbing sons

image.altText: A rocky landscape overlooks the ocean. There are around a dozen people wearing yellow uniforms unpacking truck

props.synopsis: A community-led call to remove rock lobster pots from a popular surf beach near Streaky Bay following two fatal shark attacks draws criticism from fishers who say there's "no scientific backing".

title.children: Rock lobster pots removed from surf beach following fatal shark attacks

image.altText: Colourful chalk writing on hospital glass doors saying "stand with us", :understaff, undervalued and overworked"

props.synopsis: A planned full-day doctors strike has been suspended after the South Australian doctors' union struck a pay deal with the state government.

title.children: SA doctors offered 13 per cent pay rise over four years

image.altText: Honeybees on a frame, beekeeper points a finger at the queen bee.

props.synopsis: About 600 West Australian beehives are being loaded on trucks to assist South Australian almond growers facing drought.

title.children: WA beekeepers to send convoy across the Nullarbor

image.altText: A close-up of a woman's face. She has brown hair in a pixie cut, a colourful scarf, a green knit and is smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: The wait time for some cancer survivors to donate blood has been slashed from five years after their last treatment, to just one. The change comes a fortnight after restrictions on part of the LGBTQIA+ community were loosed.

title.children: 'A huge milestone': Change to blood donation rules for cancer survivors

image.altText: A man with dark brown curly hair wears a bright yellow t-shirt with a Palestinian flag on the chest

props.synopsis: An Israeli settler who was previously sanctioned by the US was arrested and is being investigated for the alleged killing.

title.children: Israeli settler allegedly kills prominent Palestinian activist in West Bank

image.altText: A line of Palestinian men and women walking in single-file along a dirt track next to a large mound of concrete debris

props.synopsis: The ministry says 113 people were confirmed killed in the 24 hours from midday on Monday to midday on Tuesday.

title.children: Gaza death toll from Israeli offensive has passed 60,000, Palestinian health ministry says

image.altText: Houses close to the shore with rocks in front of them on a small peninsula jutting into the ocean.

props.synopsis: Property owners in the SA town of Pelican Point may be sceptical of predictions their town will be under water in 75 years but they are tired of waiting for authorities to act.

title.children: Homeowners take battle with the sea into their own hands

image.altText: An overhead view of trucks carrying hay.

props.synopsis: A truck convoy that brought more than 6,000 bales of hay from WA to drought-stricken SA has begun making drop-offs and deliveries — and while farmers remain in need of more rain, the mood on their properties is being boosted.

title.children: Desperate SA farmers have 'faith in humanity' restored as hay comes in

image.altText: A small boy holds a white sack over his right shoulder while people walk past on a dusty road between tents.

props.synopsis: Gazans say they have to risk their lives in the hope of collecting aid at sites run by the Gaza Humanitarian Foundation, where nearly 800 people have been shot and killed.

title.children: The long and dangerous journey into Gaza aid sites

image.altText: A seated man wearing a black suit and striped tie speaking with someone off camera and gesticulating.

props.synopsis: The $2.3 million lawsuit claims Annabel Digance was "maliciously prosecuted" by Peter Malinasukas, SA Police and the Director of Public Prosecutions.

title.children: Former MP files lawsuit against SA premier, claiming 'malicious prosecution'

image.altText: A woman smiling in a hi-vis vest at a playground while a man with a beard sits in a dark room

props.synopsis: Employees of disability employment provider Bedford are relieved the organisation has avoided entering administration, after the state government stepped in with a $15 million loan.

title.children: 'Means the world': Relief as disability service avoids entering administration

image.altText: Two sea lions in a cage hooked up to fluid bags

props.synopsis: As South Australia deals with its unprecedented algal bloom, a bloom of a different kind has been decimating California's coastline for four years, killing whales, dolphins and causing sea lions to behave aggressively on beaches. Warning: This story contains content that some readers may find distressing.

title.children: As South Australia deals with its algal bloom, California is dealing with another

image.altText: ATO Commissioner Chris Jordan speaks at the National Press Club.

props.synopsis: A decade ago the Australian Tax Office traded people for programs in an effort to cut costs.

title.children: Australians don't know how the tax office is performing because the ATO doesn't know itself

image.altText: Shipping containers stacked on a large boat, machinery lifting one of the metal containers

props.synopsis: The agency says "persistent uncertainties" around trade continue to dog the global economy, with US firms rushing to import goods before Donald Trump's August 1 trade deal deadline.

title.children: IMF upgrades Australian growth forecasts, despite tariffs uncertainty

image.altText: Young girl lies on a dental chair with her mouth open, blue gloved hands use dental instruments in her mouth

props.synopsis: A new survey has found most Australian parents are unaware of when to take their children to the dentist for the first time.

title.children: National survey highlights parents' lack of understanding of baby teeth

image.altText: A satellite photo of a long, thin, curved island annotated to identify military facilities along its entire length.

props.synopsis: Intelligence reveals China has built island bases capable of launching nuclear bombers from the South China Sea.

title.children: China's nuclear bombers now 'within range of Australia' from South China Sea

image.altText: Zoomed-in image of a helicopter as it strikes water.

props.synopsis: An incident in which a helicopter crew disagreed before the aircraft hit a lake due to pilot miscalculation was not reported to safety authorities, in breach of regulations.

title.children: Helicopter near-miss unreported until bystander video sent to ATSB

image.altText: Dean Winter on Metro bus  2025-06-08 10:06:00

props.synopsis: If Tasmanian Labor leader Dean Winter was hoping for an endorsement from voters, the recent election could hardly have gone worse — now, it is looking increasingly difficult for him to find a way forward without the Greens' help.

title.children: Tasmanian Labor's Winter boxed in by 'no deal with Greens' stance

image.altText: People hold umbrellas in cold wet windy weather

props.synopsis: Parts of southern Australia have recorded their wettest July in decades, and as the calendar flips to August, the rain events are forecast to continue.

title.children: Rainbands to linger into August after wettest July in decades

image.altText: Kaylee McKeown gives thumbs after winning world title.

props.synopsis: Kaylee McKeown unleashes a sensational swim to come from behind and claim the 100m backstroke gold medal at the World Swimming Championships in Singapore.

title.children: McKeown wins 100m backstroke at world championships

image.altText: Mary Fowler runs with the ball

props.synopsis: The Matildas are hoping superstar Mary Fowler will make a speedy recovery from an ACL injury, as they learn their opponents for next year's Women's Asian Cup in Australia.

title.children: Matildas coach optimistic Mary Fowler will play in Women's Asian Cup as draw revealed

image.altText: Naomi wears a white top and leans against a wall in a headshot.

props.synopsis: A common welfare test has been labelled "prehistoric" and linked to financial abuse. So why is it so controversial?

title.children: Naomi says this test is stopping her finding love

image.altText: A man tying his shoe laces next to a man in a hat.

props.synopsis: After 45 years, the Australians who competed in the 1980 Moscow Olympics will be recognised for their contribution after defying government opposition and copping public backlash.

title.children: After four decades, Australia acknowledges 1980 Moscow Olympians

image.altText: A man reads a government prohibition notice on the exterior of a bakers delight that says "closed" in large red letters.

props.synopsis: Regulators issue a prohibition order to shut down a food business when there's an imminent threat to public health. So why have so many been issued?

title.children: Almost 400pc jump in forced closures of food venues

image.altText: A soldier stands near a blue tent with a dense pine forest and snow-topped mountains in the distance behind him

props.synopsis: India's home minister has told parliament the three men killed were Pakistanis.

title.children: Gunmen involved in shooting attack in India-administered Kashmir killed

image.altText: Naomi holds onto Bing's lead as they exit a New York building. He pulls her down the street and she looks flustered.

props.synopsis: Adapted from the 2018 bestselling novel of the same name by Sigrid Nunez, The Friend is a love story about a woman and a great dane who are forced together in the depths of their shared grief.

title.children: Give the dog in Naomi Watts's latest movie an Oscar already

props.synopsis: Under Donald Trump's tariff program, Australia appeared to be one of America's least badly treated friends. But, without a new deal, the president's latest idea would change that.

title.children: Australia may no longer be Trump's least badly treated friend

image.altText: Thai military officers in green camouflage clothing standing with their arms raised on a dirt road in front of armoured vehicles

props.synopsis: Displaced residents on Cambodia's north-western border with Thailand say they are hesitant to return home, a day after the nations agreed to an immediate ceasefire to end days of intense fighting.

title.children: Refugees fear going home amid concerns Thai-Cambodia ceasefire may not hold

image.altText: a vehicle running over a crocodile at a river crossing

props.synopsis: A video of a large crocodile becoming stuck underneath a ute at a notorious river crossing in the Northern Territory has gone viral online.

title.children: Video shows crocodile stuck under ute as it crosses NT river
